nodes.text: C.B. Lee is an American author of Chinese-Vietnamese descent. She wrote "A Good Kiss," one of the short stories in the anthology book From a Certain Point of View: The Empire Strikes Back, which was published in 2020.

In an interview with the blog "Tatooine Times," Lee claimed that the Del Rey editor Tom Hoeler recruited her via her agent Thao Le to write a short story for From a Certain Point of View: The Empire Strikes Back, an anthology book based around the events of Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back. Lee's first idea for a story involved a background character seen passing Han Solo and Leia Organa and she thus developed the character into Chase Wilsorr, the subsequent main character.

Lee told the "Tatooine Times" that she wrote Wilsorr to be an "awkward disaster" and used "Be Your Best Self" as the moral of the story. She also told the blog site that as a queer author, she based Wilsorr's sexual orientation off of her own as she felt it was powerful and validating to see someone like herself in a story, especially as she had not seen other queer individuals portrayed in a positive way when she grew up. Lee's story was named "A Good Kiss," and was published in From a Certain Point of View: The Empire Strikes Back in 2020.
